byline.contributor: Kirk Semple and Paulina Villegas contributed reporting.

abstract: Protesters demanding resignation of Mexican Pres Enrique Pena Nieto march peacefully down Mexico City's main avenue hours before leader was scheduled to launch country's Independence Day celebration; already unpopular Nieto further inflamed opposition by hosting visit by United States Republican presidential nominee Donald J Trump.
lead_paragraph: Hours before the start of Independence Day celebrations, a mostly young crowd marched in the capital to express anger over scandals and a weakening economy.
snippet: Hours before the start of Independence Day celebrations, a mostly young crowd marched in the capital to express anger over scandals and a weakening economy....

headline.main: Mexican Protesters Demand Ouster of President Enrique Peña Nieto
headline.print_headline: Protesters in Mexico Seek Ouster of President
